result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater] was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian Joseph Gauthier was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment, or part-time if in school.

No consumption of alcohol or any illegal drugs.
No entrance into any bars or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
May take prescriptions according to doctor's order, but must be approved by agent.

Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and the DOC.
Give DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Fine $1998.00 to be taken from bond on deposit

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: and retroactive to any administrative suspension
